tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V3.0.0.0 -- build 3 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: NHL 2013 Stanley Cup Final: Chicago vs Boston GM6
programme.desc: With Chicago holding a 3–2 series lead heading into game six, the desperate Bruins outshot the Blackhawks 12–6 in the first period...

programme.title: UEFA EURO 2016 Final: Portugal vs France
programme.desc: The UEFA Euro 2016 Final was a football match that took place on 10 July 2016 at the Stade de France in Saint-Denis, France, to determine the winners of UEFA Euro 2016

programme.title: Shrek (2001)
programme.desc: A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back

programme.title: Monsters, Inc. (2001)
programme.desc: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, 2 monsters realize things may not be what they think

programme.title: The Incredibles (2004)
programme.desc: A family of undercover superheroes, while trying to live the quiet suburban life, are forced into action to save the world

programme.title: Bean (1997)
programme.desc: The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum

programme.title: TRON (1982)
programme.desc: A computer hacker is abducted into the digital world and forced to participate in gladiatorial games where his only chance of escape is with the help of a heroic security program

programme.title: TRON: Legacy (2010)
programme.desc: The son of a virtual world designer goes looking for his father and ends up inside the digital world that his father designed. He meets his father's corrupted creation and a unique ally who was born inside the digital world

programme.title: Mortal Kombat (1995)
programme.desc: Three unknowing martial artists are summoned to a mysterious island to compete in a tournament whose outcome will decide the fate of the world

programme.title: Us (2019)
programme.desc: A family's serene beach vacation turns to chaos when their doppelgängers appear and begin to terrorize them

programme.title: Teen Wolf (1985)
programme.desc: An ordinary high school student discovers that his family has an unusual pedigree when he finds himself turning into a werewolf

programme.title: Teen Wolf (1985)
programme.desc: An ordinary high school student discovers that his family has an unusual pedigree when he finds himself turning into a werewolf

programme.title: Bloodsport (1988)
programme.desc: Follows Frank Dux, an American martial artist serving in the military, who decides to leave the army to compete in a martial arts tournament in Hong Kong where fights to the death can occur

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt hosts the cookery show, with chef Paul A Young in the studio and special guest Stacey Dooley via videolink. Plus, highlights from the BBC Archives.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's Family Favourites
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain creates dishes perfect for winding down at the weekend, including spinach shakshuka, a quick and easy squid risotto, a twist on Sunday lunch and an orange and coffee poke cake. Nadiya's quest to find the best home-made marmalade in Britain takes her to Preston, where she meets 102-year-old Nora, and her penchant for a good cuppa lands her on Britain's first-ever tea plantation in Cornwall.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and a panel of guests discuss the latest football news.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit a flat in Forest Hill, London, and a terraced houses Nantwich, Cheshire, before speaking to their new owners.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts from Ardingly Antiques Fair, West Sussex, where a father and son compete against a mother and son. Tim Weeks leads the red team, while Charles Hanson takes charge of the blues. Away from the contest, Charlie meets a record breaker with an amazing collection of Monopoly boards that cost Â£250,000.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Football
programme.desc: A look back at the memorable 1990 semi-finals, as Liverpool faced Crystal Palace and Manchester United took on Oldham Athletic. Liverpool and United were expected to reach the final, but the underdogs in each tie helped to produce a day of enthralling drama. Presented by Guy Mowbray.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is in Surrey, checking out the cast-offs at Witley Recycling Centre, where she comes across a drum kit to repurpose.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a woman and her niece to search for a house in rural Gloucestershire, and also visits Owlpen Manor to find out how the Tudor property was rescued.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Rich brothers David and Harry together with Arit Anderson travel to the West Midlands to help Richard and Darren create their very own slice of New York's 'High Line' garden in Solihull. The New York garden has famously turned an old disused, overground train line into a thriving garden that mixes contemporary paving, grass planting and historical, leftover train tracks. The couple want this garden to remind them of their honeymoon in the Big Apple.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.sub-title: Pointless: The Good, the Bad & the Bloopers
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman presents a very special episode featuring a collection of bloopers, out-takes and unforgettable moments from the show over the past ten years, including classic nonsensical answers, exciting big wins, and a glimpse behind the curtain at parts of the show never seen before.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Scissor Sisters singer Ana Matronic, The Inbetweeners star Joe Thomas, former rugby union player Maggie Alphonsi and restaurant critic Jay Rayner answer questions on the specialist subjects of The Bionic Woman, George Orwell, Denise Lewis and the film musicals of Arthur Freed. Host John Humphrys then puts their general knowledge to the test before winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Catchpoint
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness hosts a family-friendly game show combining physical fun and an exciting question mechanic, as contestants have to think fast as they answer questions while trying to catch balls of various sizes dropped from the studio ceiling, with a variety of entertaining rounds and a cash prize at stake.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Hospital drama with the staff of Holby's accident and emergency department as they deal with more sick and injured patients. Still feeling conflicted about his feelings, Dylan tries to avoid Faith as much as possible. Meanwhile, Rash goes against Connie's wishes when dealing with a challenging patient, and Ruby makes a life changing decision.(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Ben's school parents' evening takes an unexpected turn when he begins discussing muggers, dangerous chemicals and re-enactments of the Great Plague. Karen tries to decide which religion she would like to lead, while Sue still believes Jake is hiding something. Comedy, starring Daniel Roche and Ramona Marquez.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Mrs Brown's Boys creator, writer and star Brendan O'Carroll dons Agnes's famous cardigan and curly wig once again as he throws open the doors of the larger-than-life Irish matriarch's home to host the Saturday night chat show. In the fifth episode of the series, Agnes and his comical family are joined on the show by the comedian and The Masked Singer host Joel Dommett, and morning television presenters Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes. Plus, British country duo The Shires perform live on the show.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.sub-title: Match of the Day Top Ten Podcast
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Alan Shearer and Ian Wright to discuss the top 10 players in Premier League history for a chosen category.(n)

programme.title: Match of Their Day
programme.desc: Highlights from three classic Premier League matches, as chosen by some of the regular expert analysts that appear on the show. Gary Lineker presents, with Alan Shearer and Ian Wright.(n)

programme.title: The Damned United
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling Brian Clough's ill-fated 44-day tenure as boss of Leeds United in 1974, after Don Revie's departure for the job of England's manager. Following his acrimonious split from Derby County and a brief spell at Brighton & Hove Albion, Clough arrived at Elland Road on a wave of controversy, after previously being an outspoken critic of the club, and struggled to find allies among the playing staff. With Michael Sheen, Timothy Spall, Jim Broadbent and Colm Meaney.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Ben Thompson and Rachel Burden present a round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 10.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Worship
programme.desc: The Rev Canon Leigh Richardson, sub dean and precentor, leads the service for the second Sunday after Easter from St Davids Cathedral in Pembrokeshire. With hymns sung by a Songs of Praise congregation recorded in July 2019 and filmed before the closure of all church buildings was announced.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Persephone and Debbie sample life in New Zealand, believing the country to offer a more attractive culture and society for same sex couples.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell and Martin Roberts follow the progress of terraced houses in Frizington in Cumbria and Wolverhampton and a huge commercial building in Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Caroline Hawley advise the two teams as they scour Kingston Antiques Centre in south-west London, while Natasha Raskin Sharp oversees proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: In a programme filmed before the current restrictions, Aled Jones visits the Salvation Army's Strawberry Field centre in Liverpool, a training hub for young people with learning difficulties and home to a visitor exhibition exploring the site's links to John Lennon.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Guy Mowbray looks back at memorable semi-finals, featuring Everton v Liverpool from 1977 and Chesterfield v Middlesbrough from 1997. Both matches are remembered for their controversial moments, with Everton and Chesterfield feeling aggrieved by decisions that ultimately helped their opponents progress to the finals.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore scours the recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, for unwanted items that she can breathe new life into. With three past-it projects saved, Sarah turns to clockmaker Paul Parry to help make a pair of old carriage lamps shine again, while designer-maker Daniel Heath hopes to give a 1970s sideboard a stylish update. A set of wooden bed ends gives Sarah an exciting new challenge.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin embarks on a high-energy house hunt in the Norfolk countryside where he helps a dynamic couple quit urban life in London and find a character family home for their Â£400,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: The team are in Leamington Spa to help Robert and Gemma and their daughter Darcey, who is afraid of the family's nettle-strewn, overgrown garden.(n)

programme.title: Penguins - Spy in the Huddle
programme.desc: David Tennant narrates an insight into this most intriguing and comical of birds, beginning with three different species' journeys to reach their breeding grounds. Emperor penguins cross a treacherous frozen sea, and rockhoppers brave stormy seas, before they come ashore and face a daunting assault up a 300ft cliff where they are vulnerable to predators. Meanwhile, the tropical humboldts have to evade sea lions, dodge vampire bats and battle sea birds in order to lay their eggs in the desert. All the while, their every move is being secretly filmed by hidden spy technology, including robotic penguins with cameras for eyes.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the first edition of a new look for the programme, Anita Rani is on her home patch in east London to discover what lockdown means for Woodberry Wetlands and what the future holds for the animals of Hackney City Farm. At home, she gets stuck into reinvigorating her garden and cooks up a barbecue tandoori. Adam Henson reveals the effects of the pandemic on farming and Tom Heap investigates how a new British land army might work for fruit and veg growers.(n)

programme.title: One World: Together at Home
programme.desc: Highlights of the music and entertainment event supporting the Covid-19 Response Fund and celebrating the efforts of community health workers around the world, brought together by Global Citizen and the World Health Organisation, curated in collaboration with Lady Gaga. Featuring performances by stars including Elton John, Lizzo and Stevie Wonder.(n)

programme.title: Killing Eve
programme.desc: Villanelle is approached by an old foe who offers her a new opportunity, while Eve attempts to rebuild her life after having been shot and left for dead in Rome. Kenny tries to unearth information about the Twelve, and Carolyn is undermined at work. The return of the spy thriller, starring Jodie Comer and Sandra Oh.(n)

programme.title: The Deer Hunter
programme.desc: The lives of three American steelworkers and their families are torn apart in the wake of the Vietnam War. After enduring horrific treatment in a prison camp during the conflict, the three friends return to their homes but struggle to readjust to normal life. Oscar-winning drama, starring Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, Meryl Streep, John Savage and John Cazale in his last film role.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt and Jack Monroe are joined by a range of culinary talent from across the country by live link, demonstrating a range of dishes to inspire the audience.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell revisits a bungalow in Tipton, Dion Dublin meets father-and-daughter developers in Burnley and Martin Roberts examines the potential of three flats in Lewisham, south-east London.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles introduces more footage of near misses, featuring the rescue of a hiker who was searching for his dog when a cliff crumbled beneath his feet.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion oversees proceedings in the north-west of England as experts David Harper and Gary Pe help two teams buy their three items to take to auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: It is Jimmi's first day back at work and he meets some patients who put his strength, resolve and medical skills to the test. Medical drama, starring Adrian Lewis Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the disappearance of a parishioner who believed she was being haunted by her sister, who went missing years before. Mark Williams stars in the 1950s-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, with Sorcha Cusack, Hugo Speer and Tom Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple hoping to relocate to rural Somerset on a budget of Â£700,000, looking for a home with enough land for animals and a glamping site. Away from the hunt, Alistair gets stuck in with some Cheddar making in the county where it originated.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander returns with the programme in which entrepreneurs' products are put to the test, with the inventors watching as consumers unbox, try out and give feedback. In the opening edition, they pass judgement on a make-up tool, an oven-proof breadmaker and a bicycle mirror.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton take a tour of south-east England, along the way encountering items including a potter's wheel, before an auction in Tring, Hertfordshire.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Four weeks into the Government's lockdown to save lives and protect the NHS, Jane Corbin reports from the frontline to tell the inside story of how a Coventry hospital is coping with Covid-19. She hears from doctors and nurses saving lives and dealing with death every day and asks whether there is enough protective equipment and testing to help protect them from the daily risks to their own health.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tiffany berates Keegan for his bad mood and the chaos at the Taylors' only adds to his stress, leading to an angry outburst - but he is mortified to realise Bailey has witnessed his violent. Sonia urges Whitney to get back to normal, but that proves easier said than done with Michaela posting disagreeable online comments online, leaving her crushed. Ash cries on Vinny's shoulder but they both panic when Suki arrives home early, and after speaking to Callum, Stuart is inspired to propose to Rainie again.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Bake Off judge Prue Leith, reality TV star Scarlett Moffatt, rapper Big Narstie and weatherman Tomasz Schafernaker join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A student backpacker is found dead in the showers of her hostel, and with a gun in her hand and her body slumped against the only door, all evidence points toward suicide. Humphrey isn't so sure, however, especially when he notices all her toiletries laid out and her towel missing. But when the team question the victim's boyfriend and her fellow backpackers, they find themselves with very little to go on. Meanwhile, JP prepares for the biggest day of his life as his wedding day approaches, and when Humphrey bumps into an old lady friend, Florence encourages her boss to pursue his quest for love.(n)

programme.title: Man Like Mobeen
programme.desc: With a contract out on Officer Harper's life, Mobeen steps in to try and save him and take him out of the firing line. Eight and Nate must stall the would-be assassin long enough for Mobeen and Harper to escape through the woods.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Dragons' Den investor Deborah Meaden and comedian Phil Wang joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The Bafta-award-winning host is back to review trending news stories before making online contact with guests Patrick Stewart, Ricky Gervais and Thandie Newton. Plus, more viewers recount an anecdote, desperate to avoid rejection, and there's music by Christine and the Queens.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.desc: Foreign correspondents currently posted to London look at events in the UK through outsiders' eyes, and at how the issues of the week are being tackled around the world.(n)

programme.desc: A guide to the latest gadgets, websites, games and computer industry news.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus: What You Need to Know
programme.desc: The latest information and health advice on Coronavirus, including what the symptoms are, and how to self-isolate. Presented by Victoria Derbyshire.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: It may be a global pandemic but Covid 19 has hardly united the world around a collective response. We've seen world leaders focus on national self-interest rather than international collaboration. That could spell disaster for those countries least able to cope with a protracted public health crisis. Stephen Sackur speaks to David Miliband, President of the international charity the International Rescue Committee and a former UK Foreign Secretary. What kind of world will emerge from this pandemic?(n)

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: The leader of the richest and most powerful nation on earth has just cut funding for the UN agency dedicated to the fight against global disease. What does this say about the ability of the international community to join forces to combat the threat of Covid-19? Stephen Sackur speaks to the former British Prime Minister Gordon Brown who is leading an effort to get G20 leaders to commit to a massive joint response to the pandemic. Is there any hope of real global cooperation in the current geopolitical climate?(n)

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: One year on, Jane Corbin returns to the island and meets three of those whose lives were changed that day and who have set out to help rebuild the Sri Lanka they love. (12+).(n)

programme.desc: Mark Kermode gives his unique take on the best and worst of the week's film and DVD releases.(n)

programme.desc: Four filmmakers from around the world document their experiences of life under lockdown in a series of thought provoking, funny and moving video diaries.(n)

programme.desc: Join the team on their journey of discovery as they explore new destinations around the globe and uncover hidden sides to some of the world's favourite holiday hotspots.(n)

programme.title: Global Questions
programme.desc: As the Coronavirus takes hold around the world, Global Questions invites its international audience to put their questions to a panel of experts on the risks to global health. Have lessons already been learned from the global response and how countries have handled the crisis in different ways. Join Zeinab Badawi and two leading international figures; the former Prime Minister of Denmark Helle Thorning-Schmidt and Richard Horton the Editor in Chief of the independent international Medical Journal the Lancet who will be answering your questions from around the world.(n)

programme.title: The Film Review
programme.desc: Mark Kermode gives his unique take on the best and worst of the week's film and DVD releases.(n)

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: The latest international headlines.(n)

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: Interviews with newsmakers and personalities from across the globe.(n)

programme.title: BBC World News

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: A guide to the latest gadgets, websites, games and computer industry news.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus: What You Need to Know
programme.desc: The latest information and health advice on Coronavirus, including what the symptoms are, and how to self-isolate. Presented by Victoria Derbyshire.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Dateline London
programme.desc: Foreign correspondents currently posted to London look at events in the UK through outsiders' eyes, and at how the issues of the week are being tackled around the world.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: The Papers
programme.desc: An early look at the next edition of the newspapers, featuring informed and engaging conversation with guest contributors.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The green-fingered team guides team enthusiasts through seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Monty Don and faithful hounds Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow to bring inspiration as well as outline all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend. Co-presented by Joe Swift.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Joe Tracini and Meryl Fernandes enlist expert designers and builders to construct dream dens for lucky youngsters.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the team return to Mexico to search for more dangerous creatures, including a crocodile with a nasty bite and one of the world's most vicious sharks.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores dangerous fauna in Venezuela, including green anacondas, vampire bats and scolopendras - giant venomous centipedes.(n)

programme.title: Astronauts: Do You Have What It Takes
programme.desc: The remaining candidates are put through more demanding tests by astronaut Chris Hadfield and his expert panel, with some pushed to their limits in a simulated emergency splashdown, where they have to escape from an underwater capsule. At one of the UK's biggest space-tech firms, they must successfully operate the Mars Rover, while a social event gives Chris, Kevin Fong and Iya Whiteley a further chance to scrutinise their characters.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild (?)
programme.desc: Broadcaster Clare Balding and vet Steve Leonard travel the world to watch vets perform innovative life-saving operations on a variety of wild animals. This first edition features a baby panda called Zhu Xia in south-west China in need of an MRI scan, and rescued gorilla Shufai in Cameroon, who was shot by poachers when he was a baby. Plus, a manta ray on the Japanese island of Okinawa is given an ultra-sound scan to determine if it's pregnant, and a four-ton elephant in Laos with a gunshot wound.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu (?)
programme.desc: The chefs from the North West cook mains and desserts celebrating children's literature, and while one takes inspiration from JM Barrie and his own imaginary feast, the other two choose Beatrix Potter, leaving judge Michael O'Hare to decide which lamb dish is better.(n)

programme.title: The Â£100K House: Tricks of the Trade (?)
programme.desc: Desperate to continue living in London, Adam bought one of the thinnest homes in the country. However, at six foot wide in places, the former alleyway was dark and barely habitable. Architect Katy Marks helps to transform his home with radical ideas, and Piers Taylor demonstrates how lighting, furniture and colours can make all the difference. Meanwhile, in Walsall, Hardeep and Rupinder have plenty of room for their family, but in all the wrong places. Piers Taylor designs them the ultimate social space, and encourages them to orientate their home around the garden.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Cellmates Fletcher and Godber are coerced into aiding an escape attempt organised by the sinister Grouty. However, the two jailbirds contrive to break back into prison before their absence is detected by the formidable Mr Mackay. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale, Peter Vaughan, Fulton Mackay and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: The Many Faces of (?)
programme.sub-title: The Many Faces of Ronnie Barker
programme.desc: The story of a quiet, dedicated man who might have been a bank manager, but went on to become one of the nation's most popular comedy stars. Ben Elton, Michael Grade, David Renwick and Josephine Tewson are among friends and colleagues who remember his partnership with Ronnie Corbett in sketch show The Two Ronnies, as skinflint grocer Arkwright in Open All Hours and crafty prisoner Fletch in Porridge. There is also a look at his prolific writing career and his work as an actor in serious roles.(n)

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys (?)
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the Thai capital of Bangkok, where he learns how the late 19th-century King Rama V built a grand palace and introduced railways to the country. Michael also learns that King Rama V's love of steam engines was inspired by Queen Victoria. Moving on, the presenter also confronts his fear of snakes to assist in a surgical operation on a venomous king cobra and steps into the ring to learn Muay Thai boxing.(n)

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending (?)
programme.desc: Divorced and retired, aging Londoner and vintage camera shop owner Tony Webster whittles down the solitude of his isolated existence by keeping an affectionate relationship with his ex-wife, Margaret, and by accompanying his pregnant daughter, Susie, to antenatal courses. However, the unexpected arrival of an unsettling letter disrupts the fine balance of things in Tony's orderly life, reconnecting him with his first love from college, Veronica, and the nostalgic, yet clouded memories of a distant past. Drama, starring Jim Broadbent, Charlotte Rampling and Harriet Walter.(n)

programme.title: The Conversation (?)
programme.desc: An obsessive, paranoid electronic surveillance expert - renowned within the profession as being the best - makes the unprofessional mistake of getting personally involved in a dangerous case on his San Francisco patch. Francis Ford Coppola's thriller, starring Gene Hackman, John Cazale, Robert Duvall, Allen Garfield and Harrison Ford.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two (?)
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile (?)
programme.desc: The presenters pick out their favourite films from the programme's archive, including Anita Rani surfing in Snowdonia, Ellie Harrison counting gannets, Matt Baker visiting an alpaca blood bank and Helen Skelton going fell running. Plus, Adam Henson is on his farm finding out about the pecking order of his chickens.(n)

programme.title: The British Garden: Life and Death on Your Lawn (?)
programme.desc: Chris Packham and a group of experts spend 12 months scrutinising the wildlife in eight gardens on a suburban street in Welwyn Garden City. Throughout the seasons they find male crickets that bribe females with food during sex, spiders that change colour to help catch prey, and ferocious life-and-death battles in the compost heap. They also shows a different side to familiar garden residents, revealing how a robin's red breast is actually war paint, and a single litter of foxes can have up to five different fathers.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove (?)
programme.desc: For the first time ever, the Beechgrove presenters give weekly updates from their own patches of Scotland, beginning with Carole Baxter in Aberdeenshire.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites (?)
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu (?)
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the North West go head to head to cook their six-course menus again. Not only do they need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton and broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, but also bestselling children's author and Laureate between 2011 and 2013 Julia Donaldson, who has sold over 65 million books worldwide and been translated into over 75 languages. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: Hugh's Wild West (?)
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's tour of the West Country continues as he explores the Forest of Dean. He enlists the aid of local wildlife enthusiasts to track down imposing wild boar, which have returned to the area for the first time in 300 years. He also has a close encounter with a goshawk, a bird of prey that specialises in hunting in woodland, and one that has come to be known locally as 'the phantom of the forest'.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics (?)
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces action from the 1982 World Championship final between Ray Reardon and Alex Higgins, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Alex Higgins: The People's Champion (?)
programme.desc: James Nesbitt narrates a look back at the often controversial life of the two-time world snooker champion, who was widely regarded as one of the most naturally gifted players in the history of his sport, but whose brilliance was flawed by his demons. With contributions by members of his family, as well as fellow snooker greats Jimmy White, Ronnie O'Sullivan, Steve Davis and Dennis Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve (?)
programme.desc: Simon travels across Central America, from the Caribbean to the Pacific. Along the way, he goes diving on a coral reef on the coast of Belize, and witnesses a gun battle between park rangers and intruders in Chiquibul National Park. He also discovers how climate change has left Guatemala devastated by famine and drought, reports on measures to curb gang violence in El Salvador, and learns how Costa Rica aims to become the world's first carbon neutral country by 2021.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World (?)
programme.desc: After a frantic race to make it to Ilha Grande, the teams set off for the next checkpoint in Mendoza, Western Argentina, but as the race enters its final phase, the depleted budgets begin to take their toll on the competitors. Emon and Jamiul are the first to set off, but disagree about the best route to take. Jen and Rob are the team with the most money remaining, but also have clashing priorities over how best to proceed. Jo and Sam look for jobs that include bed and board to save their money, while Dom and Lizzie hitch a ride and receive an unexpected invitation.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates (?)
programme.sub-title: Stacey Dooley: Locked Up With the Lifers
programme.desc: The presenter visits a women's prison in America that has adopted a radical new approach to incarceration based on giving the inmates a sense of purpose and self-esteem. She meets eight prisoners who are serving life sentences for murder, and discovers the complex sexual relationships that have developed among many of the inmates.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Homemade Show (?)
programme.desc: Rough-and-ready self-made comedy show featuring Scottish comedian Limmy, aka Brian Limond. Limmy reveals his secret life as a hitman, gives sneaky advice to youngsters and explains why he's paranoid about hanging his minging towel on the washing line. Plus, a businessman has a crisis of confidence when he accidentally goes to put his kettle in the fridge.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows (?)
programme.desc: Sitcom spin-off from the movie in which a documentary crew follow the lives of a group of vampire housemates in New York. Ottoman warlord Nandor, British dandy Laszlo, seductive Nadja, tedious 'energy vampire' Colin, and human servant Guillermo receive a visit from their dark lord, who demands to know why they have yet to conquer the United States. Starring Matt Berry, Kayvan Novak and Natasia Demetriou, and written and directed by the original movie's stars Taika Waititi and Jemaine Clement.(n)

programme.title: Question Time (?)
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: Fraud Squad NHS (?)
programme.desc: The investigators look into an IT support worker shamelessly helping himself to hospital computers and a gang illegally fly-tipping on an industrial scale.(n)

programme.title: Holby City (?)
programme.desc: Xavier is determined to prove that Cameron killed Evan as the day of the disciplinary hearing dawns, but he may not be able to gather enough evidence to clear his name. Essie faces her first round of chemotherapy, and Sacha begs her to tell her family and friends the truth. Nicky is given the opportunity to carry out a challenging heart transplant under Jac's supervision.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two (?)
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Pointless (?)
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef (?)
programme.desc: The remaining 16 contestants are split into two groups as they compete for the chance of their first taste of working in a professional kitchen. The first eight cook a dish for John Torode and Gregg Wallace, with the best five heading to Da Terra in east London to work under chef Rafael Cagali. During a busy lunch service, the amateurs will be entirely responsible for serving the restaurant's menu to paying customers. Will any buckle under the intense pressure as they cook in a demanding new environment?(n)

programme.title: Curiosity (?)
programme.desc: Ian and Toby from Essex and Charley and David also from Essex compete for a chance to meet today's curious collector Charlie. With Â£1,000 at stake in the Curiosity Shop, who will curate the most valuable collection? Paul Martin hosts.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics (?)
programme.desc: Steve Davis v Jimmy White. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the 1984 World Championship final, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Flog It (?)
programme.desc: Antiques experts David Harper and Claire Rawle search for items to sell at auction at Penrhyn Castle in north Wales. Presented by Paul Martin.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games (?)
programme.desc: Amanda Abbington, Michael Buerk, Shappi Khorsandi and Elis James test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown (?)
programme.desc: Poultry farmers Nick and Jacob and organic and heritage fruit and vegetable farmer Patrick display their wares at Alexandra Palace Farmer's Market.(n)

programme.title: Horizon (?)
programme.sub-title: The Restaurant That Burns Off Calories
programme.desc: Maitre d' Fred Sirieix and doctor Zoe Williams open a restaurant with a difference, welcoming 20 unsuspecting diners for a slap-up meal. It all sounds normal enough, but at the back of house is a fully functioning gym, where a group of fitness fanatics are poised on exercise bikes, treadmills and rowing machines, ready to burn off every single calorie ordered and consumed by the diners. This experiment is based on scientific research that suggests that people eat 20 percent less when shown how much effort it takes to remove excess calories.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9 (?)
programme.desc: According to one report, the three most stressful experiences in life are the death of a spouse, divorce, and imprisonment. Moving house is only 32nd on the list, but anything can happen in this tale involving the Handle Me Gently removals company and a nervous resident. Written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with Emilia Fox, Monica Dolan and Nick Moran.(n)

programme.title: Sicily: Wonder of the Mediterranean (?)
programme.desc: Part one of two. Michael Scott traces the history of Sicily, from the first arrival of ancient Greek settlers 3,000 years ago to the arrival of the Byzantine Empire. He begins his journey on the slopes of Mount Etna, Europe's largest active volcano, and discovers how the Greeks began to settle on Sicily's east coast - planting their olives and vines and building great city states that soon came to rival even Athens itself.(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show
programme.desc: Guest host Sean Hayes takes the reigns once more and is joined by Chelsea Handler, who tells him all about her recent projects.(n)

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents the dating show, with a stripper, a farmer and a gymnast and Scarlett Moffatt's ex-boyfriend entering the 'love lift', and giving it their all in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date. But they must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval.(n)

programme.title: Step Up Revolution
programme.desc: An aspiring dancer comes to Miami to pursue her dreams, and falls in love with the leader of a street performance crew. When she learns the group's neighbourhood is to be demolished, driving the residents from their homes, she joins forces with them to organise a protest show. Dance drama sequel, starring Kathryn McCormick and Ryan Guzman.(n)

programme.title: Step Up Revolution
programme.desc: An aspiring dancer comes to Miami to pursue her dreams, and falls in love with the leader of a street performance crew. When she learns the group's neighbourhood is to be demolished, driving the residents from their homes, she joins forces with them to organise a protest show. Dance drama sequel, starring Kathryn McCormick and Ryan Guzman.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois books a couple's vacation, but it turns out to be a marriage counselling programme. Carter is frustrated because the kids are so into their electronics, and tries to force them into playing the old-fashioned way.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: While on vacation in Los Angeles, California, Stan joins the world of old Hollywood. Meanwhile, Roger kennel trains Steve and Hayley.(n)

programme.title: The Cleveland Show
programme.sub-title: The Wide World of the Cleveland Show
programme.desc: An exploration of the Brown-Tubbs family's various incarnations around the world. Cleveland is unhappy with Junior's choice of birthday celebration in Mexico and must choose a successor in a mob-style parody set in Italy. Meanwhile, in Japan, he builds a robot version of himself to work late at the office.(n)

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Action-packed game show, with commentary from Irish comedy duo the Rubberbandits. Ten contestants are given 50 lives to take on a series of tricky challenges. The aim of the game is to complete five of them without losing all of their lives. Challenges include Tiny Bike, Dizzy Hurdle and Groin Croissant.(n)

programme.title: ITV2 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmonds presents more weird and wonderful Guinness World Records, including the most vehicles to run over a person and the most eggs carried on a single hat.(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show
programme.desc: The comedian presents from her own home, and speaks to Drew and Brittany Brees, who have donated $5 million to the State of Louisiana to fight the Covid-19 crisis..(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show
programme.desc: Ellen is joined by comedy actor Adam Levine, while Nicholas Braun discusses hit TV series Succession. Plus, Maroon 5 perform Memories.(n)

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Three singletons try to impress professional footballer Osebi in Manchester, who then goes on a date with the person whose taste in clothes he liked best.(n)

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: In Cardiff, bricklayer Alex, support worker Kevin and plasterer Zhane are all hoping to win a date with Shannon, a self-proclaimed modern-day Marilyn Monroe.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win Â£250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's Alien Fun Capsule
programme.desc: Suzanne Packer, Moira Stuart, Kara Tointon and Tom Davis take part in the madcap panel show presented by the comedian, who presides over two teams nominally tasked with saving planet Earth from any potential alien invasion. Each team must find clips, people and anything that is fun or funny enough for Harry to place in the capsule which, in the event that the planet is invaded by aliens, can be presented to them to demonstrate earthlings are good fun and therefore worthy of saving.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.sub-title: You've Been Framed! Gold: A-Z of Growing Up
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates more home videos sent in by viewers, featuring classic clips from children around the world as this show focuses on people's formative years.(n)

programme.title: Spy Kids 4: All the Time in the World
programme.desc: A secret agent decides to retire after having a baby, while her two stepchildren remain completely unaware of her exciting past. They stumble on to the truth when she is recalled to duty and, with the aid of two former junior spies, they help battle an evil mastermind who has the power to control time. Family adventure, starring Jessica Alba, Jeremy Piven, Rowan Blanchard and Mason Cook.(n)

programme.title: Spy Kids 4: All the Time in the World
programme.desc: A secret agent decides to retire after having a baby, while her two stepchildren remain completely unaware of her exciting past. They stumble on to the truth when she is recalled to duty and, with the aid of two former junior spies, they help battle an evil mastermind who has the power to control time. Family adventure, starring Jessica Alba, Jeremy Piven, Rowan Blanchard and Mason Cook.(n)

programme.title: The Lego Batman Movie
programme.desc: The caped crusader swings into action to save Gotham City from the Joker. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Will Arnett, Michael Cera, Rosario Dawson, Ralph Fiennes and Zach Galifianakis.(n)

programme.title: The Lego Batman Movie
programme.desc: The caped crusader swings into action to save Gotham City from the Joker. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Will Arnett, Michael Cera, Rosario Dawson, Ralph Fiennes and Zach Galifianakis.(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World (?)
programme.desc: Decades on from the creation of Jurassic Park, a fully operational attraction filled with genetically engineered dinosaurs has been opened on the island. In need of a new attraction, the company behind the park creates an entirely new species - but it quickly escapes to terrorise the tourists. Action adventure sequel, starring Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard.(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World (?)
programme.desc: Decades on from the creation of Jurassic Park, a fully operational attraction filled with genetically engineered dinosaurs has been opened on the island. In need of a new attraction, the company behind the park creates an entirely new species - but it quickly escapes to terrorise the tourists. Action adventure sequel, starring Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy (?)
programme.desc: An episode of the comedy set in a future in which Stewie has made a fortune and is living a life of luxury, when Brian brings news that his father Peter is dying.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy (?)
programme.desc: Peter claims he could beat Liam Neeson in a fight, but is challenged to prove it. Lois becomes a class helper and pays more attention to the other children than she does to Stewie, while Quagmire organises a festival celebrating his own sexual history.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy (?)
programme.desc: Peter and Carter go to Africa to get their money back after they are swindled in an e-mail scam, while Brian pursues Meg's friend Patty.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy (?)
programme.desc: Peter claims he could beat Liam Neeson in a fight, but is challenged to prove it. Lois becomes a class helper and pays more attention to the other children than she does to Stewie, while Quagmire organises a festival celebrating his own sexual history.(n)

programme.title: American Dad (?)
programme.desc: When the Memari's get robbed, Francine orders Stan to spare no expense and he installs the most sophisticated system possible. However, her paranoia takes hold and she begins to regard everything as a possible threat. Meanwhile, Steve tries to adopt Hayley's laid-back approach to school work in the hope it will improve his grades.(n)

programme.title: American Dad (?)
programme.desc: A broke Hayley gets an office job and falls for a cute colleague, prompting her to consider embarking on an affair while on a work retreat to Belize. Meanwhile, Stan chauffeurs Steve and Francine to a mother-son dance, but things turn ugly when he refuses to let them dance together.(n)

programme.title: The Cleveland Show (?)
programme.sub-title: When a Man (or a Freight Train) Loves His Cookie
programme.desc: Cookie is upset when Freight Train misses their wedding anniversary party and decides to go on tour with George Clinton and the P-Funk All-Stars. Cleveland convinces him to track his wife down and regain her trust, while Cleveland Jr poses as an insurance executive in an office supplies shop.(n)

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show (?)
programme.desc: Comedy routines by Glenn Moore, Adam Hess, Dane Baptiste, Suzi Rufell, Seann Walsh, Catherine Bohart, Alex Edelman and Brennan Reece are reconstructed as sketches.(n)

programme.title: Don't Hate the Playaz (?)
programme.desc: Maya Jama, Sabrina Washington and London Hughes go up against Lady Leshurr, Sophie Duker and Ms Banks in another rap and hip-hop battle. Hosted by Jordan Stephens.(n)

programme.title: ITV2 Nightscreen (?)
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping (?)
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records (?)
programme.desc: Matt Edmonds offers his unique insights on some Guinness World Records, including the world's shortest and longest cats, the highest waterfall jump and the longest underwater kiss.(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show (?)
programme.desc: The comedian presents from her own home, and speaks to Drew and Brittany Brees, who have donated $5 million to the State of Louisiana to fight the Covid-19 crisis..(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale (?)
programme.desc: Mandy convinces a sad Paul that Vinny no longer lives with her, but, as everyone else enjoys the wedding reception, she is clearly troubled by the secret she's still keeping. Belle is taken aback when Jamie declares that he loves her and is going to leave Andrea for her.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street (?)
programme.desc: Asha is sickened to realise somebody posted her naked pictures and they have gone viral, while Leanne is furious to realise Steve is seriously considering taking legal advice. Johnny takes matters into his own hands and Ken's election campaign is on the up.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed (?)
programme.desc: Surreal comedy from the mind of Harry Hill, inspired by viewers' home videos. An SUV gives birth to a pensioner, a penguin answers the call of nature during a parade, and a dolphin ruins Harry's childhood memories. Plus, why cats and tablet computers don't go well together.(n)

programme.title: Superstore (?)
programme.desc: The employees are given a chance to win a cash bonus if they hit a sales target by the end of the day.(n)

programme.title: Superstore (?)
programme.desc: At the store's wedding day sale, Cheyenne and Bo make lavish purchases for their own nuptials. Glenn uses the promotion to show his support for same-sex marriage.(n)

programme.title: Dinner Date (?)
programme.desc: Amy from London is given five menus constructed by a quintet of potential sweethearts, and must decide which three she would like to meet based on the meals they planned.(n)

programme.title: Dress to Impress (?)
programme.desc: Michael Jackson impersonator Mitch, bar manager Aiden and student JJ try to impress Becky, a student from Leeds, with their outfit choices.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale (?)
programme.desc: Mandy convinces a sad Paul that Vinny no longer lives with her, but, as everyone else enjoys the wedding reception, she is clearly troubled by the secret she's still keeping. Belle is taken aback when Jamie declares that he loves her and is going to leave Andrea for her.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street (?)
programme.desc: Asha is sickened to realise somebody posted her naked pictures and they have gone viral, while Leanne is furious to realise Steve is seriously considering taking legal advice. Johnny takes matters into his own hands and Ken's election campaign is on the up.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed (?)
programme.desc: Comedian Harry Hill puts his own spin on a selection of clips filmed by viewers. A man hunts mosquitos with a bow and arrow, the 60 Minute Makeover team demolishes a house and a superhuman child wrecks his mother's kitchen. Plus, the clam that doubles as a Mick Jagger lookalike.(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show (?)
programme.desc: The comedian talks to singer Pink about her donation to the Covid-19 crisis, and actor David Spade, who discusses The Wrong Missy.(n)

programme.title: Dinner Date (?)
programme.desc: Ben from Hampshire picks three blind dates from five potential partners, based entirely on the three course menus they have created. Having dined with the three women, he decides who he wants to see again.(n)

programme.title: Dress to Impress (?)
programme.desc: Three singletons try to impress dental nurse Cece in Cardiff, who then goes on a date with the person whose taste in clothes she liked best.(n)

programme.title: Superstore (?)
programme.desc: Olympic fever hits the store, Amy meets a hero from her childhood, while Glenn's extreme patriotism impacts his work. Comedy, starring America Ferrera.(n)

programme.title: Superstore (?)
programme.desc: The staff are waiting for the delivery of new Cloud 9 signs, but the truck is delayed and everyone ends up locked in overnight due to a computer error.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed (?)
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. A squirrel steals a mobile, a fox attacks a golfer and a beach wedding is ruined. Plus, a skunk stinks out a swimming pool and a toddler murders a smurf.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed (?)
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, including one viewer's take on Ninja Warrior, a glimpse of what the future holds for Ant & Dec, the dangers of taking a selfie while riding a bike, and an explosive incident involving a grandmother.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed (?)
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another selection of comical mishaps filmed by viewers. This week, a mechanic uses an airbag as a launch-pad. A moped selfie causes a nasty accident that results in a string of profanities, and a peck from a tropical bird make's Grandad's eyes water. Plus, a video detailing the dangers of wearing a monkey as a wig.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed (?)
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another selection of mishaps, including a lorry driver reversing into a lamp-post, a builder falling through a ceiling and a bulldog firing snot at its owner.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men (?)
programme.desc: Jake develops a crush on his chemistry tutor, who in turn takes a liking to Walden. Meanwhile, Evelyn is hired as an interior designer and Alan starts reading one of Charlie's old journals. Comedy, starring Ashton Kutcher.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men (?)
programme.desc: Walden has a still-grieving Alan institutionalised when a redecoration of the beach house prompts him to begin acting strangely, dressing and sleeping around like his dead brother Charlie.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy (?)
programme.desc: Peter is the new coach of Quahog's minor league baseball team and accidentally becomes the face of social justice when he kneels during the national anthem after overeating.(n)

programme.title: American Dad (?)
programme.desc: Hayley finds herself pushed aside when Jeff's racing greyhound Fleabiscuit wins the Chimdale Stakes. Klaus, believing that the mechanical rabbit Wizbo is too plain looking, sets out to give it a little more personality and ends up going for a wild ride.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy (?)
programme.desc: Mayor West raises the drinking age to 50, leaving Brian - thanks to dog years - the only one old enough to buy alcohol for Peter.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy (?)
programme.desc: Stewie becomes addicted to ADHD medication, while Peter and Quagmire start their own cookery shows.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy (?)
programme.desc: Quagmire tells Ida that he is in love with Lois, which Peter accidentally overhears. Peter becomes furious with his friend and Lois is forced to to resolve the situation.(n)

programme.title: American Dad (?)
programme.desc: When Stan lies about his texting and driving accident, he takes a seizure medication and suffers from the side effects, while Roger tries to help Steve overcome performance anxiety.(n)
